abstracts.cdata!:
Overall, project ratings are
            satisfactory, with a likely sustainability, and substantial
            institutional development impact. Lessons suggest that the
            changing nature of a research organization, such as national
            agricultural research systems (NARS), from government
            entities to semi-autonomous organizations, does not
            necessarily imply a more dynamic management, nor greater
            efficiency. Rather, effective research management systems,
            specifically research planning, and operational procedures,
            as well as budgeting, financial management, and controls
            need to be in place, and within the context of a pro-active
            Bank supervision, and local management, with attention to
            performance indicators, and monitoring. To exploit genetic
            potential of existing varieties, research and extension
            should address farm, and crop management constraints
            vis-e-vis plant breeding. Likewise, as illustrated by the
            cassava, and water hyacinth programs, research should be
            focused on few production issues, whose resolution may lead
            to rapid, and substantial impacts, instead of diverting over
            a large number of small activities. Given the under-funded
            status of many NARS, financial sustainability should not
            depend on Government, and donor support alone, but fund
            raising should become a recognized function of research managers.
